notes.value:
Butterfly/Moth CR -

Source: Ultimate Wilderness pg. 192

Init 0;

Defense

AC 15, Touch 15, Flat-Footed 14 (+1 Dex, +4 size)
Hit Points 1 (1 HD; 1d8-3)
Fort 1, Ref 1, Will 1 Immune mind-affecting effects;

Offense

Speed 30 ft. (average)

Statistics

Str 1, Dex 13, Con 4, Int 0, Wis 12, Cha 7
Base Atk +0; CMB +-3; CMD 2
Feats
Skills Fly +7
Languages

Ecology

Environment: any temperate or warm
Organization: solitary, pair, or kaleidoscope (3-100)
Treasure: none

Description

Butterflies are delicate, brightly colored insects that feed on nectar and other sources of sugar. Moths have the same statistics as butterflies, though they tend to be active at night. The butterfly (or moth) presented here is a particularly large specimen with a wingspan of just over 6 inches, yet it is still completely harmless and awards no XP if slain.

RAW INPUT

description.value: sbc | Here you’ll find information on how the monster fits into the world, notes on its ecology and society, and other bits of useful lore and flavor that will help you breathe life into the creature when your PCs encounter it.

sbc | Conversion Buff

This Buff was created by sbc to compensate for differences between the input and the values FoundryVTT calculates automatically.

Especially when the pathfinder system gets upgraded, entries in compendiums get updated or foundry changes in some way, this buff may become outdated.

For most mooks the conversion should more or less work, but for important NPCs or creatures it is adviced to double check the conversion manually.
